I've found a repro related to BEA extensions of the WTP projects (I'm unable to repro using the standard WTP projects); this indicates that there is something specific to our BEA environment that is triggering the NPE (perhaps a concurrently running job...), however, the fact that an NPE is possible needs to be addressed:

-Create an BEA-specific EAR
-Create two BEA-specific module projects, add them to the EAR
-Close and restart Eclipse
-You get the stack; debugging indicates that the ReferencedComponent passed to StructuredEdit.createVirtualReference() for the second module project is not correctly initialized (the handle is null, however, the "handle" attribute of the "dependent-module" element in the .component file for the EAR project does have a valid value.

Getting this one tracked down for 1.0.1 is important for us.
Ted was unable to repro this so I'm going to mark it as invalid for now; if someone else can repro it, I'll reopen.
Looks like this is only occuring when I open Eclipse w/ the Navigator view showing; so, I think plugin activation order is involved

I went ahead and added the null guards to avoid the null pointer exceptions.  I am not sure about the timing issue or if you will still see odd behavior since I can't reproduce...

Let me know if you still see issues.  This will be in the 011206 WTP 1.0.1 committers build.
